answers.answer: It is your body and your life. If you want to see this pregnancy through then do it. Don't let friends scare you. Every baby is unique and a precious gift. Go with your heart and try your best to be healthy walk every day.I hope everything works out the way u want it too best of luck.!

Yes, go with ur heart and do not let others influence u one way or the other!I just been thru a mc and had a profound understanding the precious of life!What a wonderful gift at 40 and please take good care of urself !  I pray everything will work out for the best 4 u and the baby!

I am 37 years old and pregnant for the first time and I am now 34 weeks pregnant.  I had lap band surgery 4 years ago and had lost 90 lbs when I got pregnant. I was also considered high risk bcuz of my age and weigh lost surgery. I had genetic testing done around 15 weeks pregnant and was told everything is great with my baby. Might I add that I also work as an OB nurse for 12 years where we handle mainly high risk patients who have high blood pressure among other issues and I have NEVER seen a baby being born with down syndrome due to high blood pressure or bcuz of age. Ad a matter of fact all the babies I have delivered that have had down syndrome (which have not been probably more than 10 in 12 years) are from very healthy young mothers.  So please don't listen to your friends. If your really worried about it don't make any decisions til after you have seen a genetic specialist and let her be the one to tell you if you are at risk. And as far as you bypass surgery goes there are other ways besides solid food to get your nutrients for you and baby like ensure. Just make sure you eat as healthy as you can when you do eat. Best of luck to you.

Thank you all for your prayers and kind words.I've been trying for years and i'm over the moon when i found out i'm pregnant. This is truly a great gift.I'm seeing the specialist this friday for more blood test. I think they are testing my hcg level again and for gestational diabetes.They are worried for etopic pregnancy too as they couldn't see the sac at 4weeks plus. From my understanding 4weeks plus is too early to see anything but dr said ay hcg level 2900, we could have seen something. Im really hopefull for good news this Friday.
I hope you receive good news this Friday, I'll be praying for you!!
Best wishes to you! Try not to stress, enjoy this gift.

43 gastric bypass 2001 first pregnancy.I am "high risk" but Dr. Says my pregnancy has been very easy so far and healthy! No morning sickness, just fatigue and severe anemia which I had infusions for. At 23 weeks. They can do genetic testing at about 12-16 for Downs and 20 for spina bifada. Mine all neg. Having a boy, who may be at a higher risk for autism....don't have a pre natal test for that yet....but I am rolling with God's blessing and pray baby is heakthy. If autistic, I know that God has something very important to learn....I take my pregnancy 1 day at a time. Anything can happen. Waited to tell family, friends, work until after genetic tests....no need to get everyone excited over something that may self terminate early.....Will decorate nursery 4-6 weeks before birth....If you want the baby, keep taking care of self, but plan for baby 1 day at a time

Thank you Chatamorena and Drcsue for your prayers.To KJ. Thanks for sharing and your advice. Felt better reading posts by other high risk pregnancy mamas sharing their experiences. Really appreciate the time taken to post a note to me..

I am 37. I had lap band done 10 years ago. Lost 170 lbs. I just delivered my third child on 01 21 2015. All of my babies are now healthy thriving children. Just do what your OB says and what your gastric dr says and you will do great. Good luck mama.

Also.....dont worry about gestational diabetes. I have had it with my last 2 pregnancies. If anything,  it will help you eat healthy and exercise regularly. And welcome to motherhood....where the worrying starts before they are even born. It is natural to feel worried about something as precious as the life you created.  I am thinking it never ends.... congratulations and I wish you all the best.

question: Hi all. Im 40 years old and this is my 2nd pregnancy. I'm now 5 weeks pregnant and i was just discharged from hospital due to my high blood pressure. My 1st pregnancy ended miscarriage more than 15 years ago. Due to my age, hypertension and asthma history, this pregnancy is considered high risk. In addition, i went for gastric sleeve operation about 2 years ago and i'm not eating as much. During my last hospital stay, 2 diff dr have asked me if I would like to keep the baby. Recently some friends  have telling me that i'm high risk for down syndrome baby. With the daily hypertension medication combo with unhealthy diet.. im now thinking if i'm being selfish.. Feeling emotional. Just want to share.
title: 40 year old first pregnancy post gastric sleeve
